title: Shrimp And Avocado Salad On Endive Leaves
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Shrimp And Avocado Salad On Endive Leaves a try. Watching your figure? This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe has 20 calories, 3g of protein, and 1g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 24. For 33 cents per serving, this recipe covers 2% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 2 people found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 2 hours and 37 minutes. If you have to 3 belgian endives, coarse salt, lime juice, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 21%. This score is not so tremendous. Try Avocado, Shrimp, And Endive Salad, Avocado, Shrimp, and Endive Salad, and Hazelnut Shrimp in Endive Leaves for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. You could try Tangent Paragon Vineyard Pinot Gris. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.6 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Tangent Paragon Vineyard Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Framed by a light lemony acidity and vibrant minerality, thispinot gris was made in the traditional dry style of northern Italy.It is surprisingly full-bodied, with concentrated flavors of peach,ginger and tropical fruit, with a hint of a pine-resin character. A great wine on its own, Tangent Pinot Gris pairs well with a widerange of foods including seafood, pasta with light sauces, evengrilled sausages.
